p: Edible packaging can be a superficial coating on the food or continuous layers between compartments/ingredients of the heterogeneous products (e.g., pizza, bakery fillings, and toppings) [ 8]. The coating can also be applied on individual pieces of the whole product, which have not been individually packaged due to practical arguments, such as fresh-cut melons, kiwis, strawberries, nuts, beans, pears [ 11].
